excerpt: Constructed in 1113 under the reign of King Ajaypal Chauhan, this fort is an impressive sight.
detail_description: Perched on a hill, Taragarh Fort in Bundi is a captivating sight with its rich history dating back to 1113. The fort and the sprawling Garh Palace offer an abundance of historic marvels for enthusiasts. Nature lovers can also revel in the beauty of Jait Sagar Lake and explore Raniji ki Baori. Visitors can expect a bustling atmosphere during peak season from October to January, while February and March provide moderate weather for a more tranquil experience.
name: Taragarh Fort
address: FJ2P+6VV, Nahar ka Chauhatta, Teerath, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

excerpt: This picturesque estate where the writer Rudyard Kipling once stayed features history exhibits.
detail_description: Sukh Mahal is a picturesque estate that boasts of its rich history and serves as a popular tourist attraction. The place features an on-site museum, which adds to the charm of this lakeside location. Visitors can enjoy the serene view of the lake while relaxing in its tranquil surroundings. Additionally, it offers beautiful gardens and is ideal for photography enthusiasts. Overall, Sukh Mahal is an excellent place to explore for those looking for a change from their routine activities.
name: Sukh Mahal
address: FJ3R+3QP, MDR 52, Teerath, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

excerpt: Renowned 1699 stepwell, around 46m deep, with intricate carvings & a pillared, arched entrance.
detail_description: Raniji Ki Baori, also known as the Queens Stepwell, is a remarkable 1699 stepwell located in Rajasthan. This architectural marvel was built by Rani Nathavati Ji to provide water during droughts and showcases intricate carvings and sculptures, making it a masterpiece of Rajput architecture. The stepwell descends 13 stories into the ground and is surrounded by exquisitely carved pillars and galleries.
name: Raniji Ki Baori
address: Bundi Rd, near k. N, Adisal Singh Colony, Gayatri Nagar, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

excerpt: Royal Rajput castle with smaller palaces dating from the 17th century, home to colorful wall murals.
detail_description: Garh Palace, also known as Bundi Palace, is a royal Rajput castle with smaller palaces dating back to the 17th century. Rudyard Kipling was so captivated by its charm that he mentioned it in his writings. The palace boasts colorful wall murals and engravings, although some areas are closed to the public. From the magnificent Taragarh Fort to the sprawling Garh Palace, visitors will find plenty of historic sites to explore in Bundi.
name: Garh Palace
address: 717, Sadar Baazar, Teerath, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

excerpt: Artificial lake featuring a half-submerged temple dedicated to Varuna, the god of oceans & water.
detail_description: Nawal Sagar is a charming artificial lake located in Bundi, surrounded by old streets and crumbling palaces. The lake features a half-submerged temple dedicated to Varuna, the god of oceans and water. It offers picturesque views with shrines dotting its center and a dramatic backdrop provided by an improbable gothic palace hanging from the far mountain. Visitors can hire a boat to ride around the ancient temple or capture incredible reflections of the town's skyline for photography enthusiasts.
name: Nawal Sagar
address: Teerath, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001

detail_description: Bundi Fort Palace, located in the city of Bundi in Rajasthan, India, is a magnificent historical site that showcases the grandeur of the city's former Rajput kings. The Taragarh fort, built in 1354, boasts impressive battlements and ramparts on a high hill with remarkable stone architecture. Other popular attractions in the area include Bundi Palace, Raniji-ki-Baori, and Nawal Sagar.
name: Bundi Fort Palace
address: CJXP+F48, Teerath, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: Chitrashala is a captivating complex located within the Bundi Palace, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It showcases exquisite paintings that blend Mewari, Deccan, and Mughal styles, predominantly depicting the lilas of Krishna or Shrinathji. Despite its historical significance, the site suffers from neglect and requires restoration. The wall paintings portray scenes related to Lord Krishna and the kingdom of Bundi.
name: Chitrashala
address: 717, Sadar Baazar, Teerath, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: Jait Sagar Lake, located about 2 km from Bundi, is a popular tourist spot adjacent to Taragarh hill. This picturesque 1.5 km long lake is surrounded by hills and adorned with lotus during monsoon and winter. It's easily accessible via local transport and offers a leisurely day out or exploration of nearby attractions like Raniji ki Baori and Chaurasi Khambon ki Chhatri.
name: Jait Sagar Lake
address: Bundi, Rajasthan 323001

detail_description: The 84 Pillared Cenotaph in Bundi, Rajasthan is a magnificent structure built by Maharaja Rao Raja Anirudh in 1683 to honor his foster brother, Deva. Legend has it that the umbrella-like roof, supported by 84 pillars, covers a large Shivling at the center. The cenotaph is made of local stone and surrounded by a wall.
name: 84 Pillared Cenotaph
address: 84 pillared cenotaph (Chaurasi Khambhon-ki-Chatri), Devpura, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

excerpt: Bundi is a town in the Hadoti region of Rajasthan state in northwest India. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Bundi, located in the Hadoti region of Rajasthan, India, was once the capital of the princely state of Rajputana agency. The district is named after this former princely state and is a significant historical location in northwest India.
name: Bundi
address: Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: In the charming city of Bundi, Shikar Burj is a must-visit tourist spot. Situated near Sukh Mahal, it served as a hunting lodge for the rulers of Bundi. The city is renowned for its intricate murals and carvings, medieval forts, havelis, temples with stunning stone idols, palaces, and chattris with carved pillars.
name: Shikar Burj
address: MDR 52, Akoda, Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: Bhoraji Ji Ka Kund is a stunning historical site that dates back to the 16th century. These water reservoirs were ingeniously constructed to provide water to the drought-stricken regions of Bundi. The beauty and significance of this ancient structure make it a must-visit destination for travelers.
name: Bhoraji Ji Ka Kund
address: CJXH+3PF, Balchand Pada, hotel bundi house ,Bohra ji ka Kund, Balchand Para, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: Moti Mahal is a unique and stunning palace nestled in the Aravali mountains, resembling a precious pearl in its shell. Constructed in the mid-1600s by Maharao Raja Bhao Singh as a defensive stronghold for Bundi, it has been enhanced over time by subsequent kings with additional features such as gardens, step wells, lavish marble and gold embellishments, and intricate mirror work within its interiors.
name: Moti Mahal
address: CJMX+28J, Police Lines, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: Dhabhai Kund in Bundi, Rajasthan is a remarkable piece of architecture dating back to the 16th century. This step well boasts over 700 symmetric steps and is renowned for its fascinating geometric construction. It was originally built to provide water during times of drought and features beautiful carvings and murals. Despite the dusty water, it's a peaceful place with a temple dedicated to Lord Shiva.
name: Dhabhai Kund
address: CJPQ+J99, Gayatri Nagar, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Bundi, Jait Sagar is a breathtaking lake that captivates visitors with its stunning natural beauty. Surrounded by lush hills and featuring the enchanting Sukh Mahal on its banks, this picturesque spot offers a magical atmosphere that's hard to resist. Just 2 km from the bustling town center, Jait Sagar is easily accessible and serves as a popular excursion for both locals and tourists alike. The lake stretches approximately 1.
name: Jait Sagar
address: Teerath, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: The Bundi Museum, also known as Sukh Mahal, is located within a beautiful palace and showcases a diverse array of historical artifacts, sculptures, and paintings that depict the rich history of Bundi. It offers visitors an opportunity to delve into the glorious past of this region through its carefully curated collection.
name: Bundi Museum
address: CJWP+V59, Teerath, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: Nestled in the charming town of Bundi, Ringo Starr Bundi Restaurant stands out as a must-visit culinary gem. With an inviting atmosphere and a menu that boasts fresh and flavorful dishes, it has quickly become a favorite among locals and travelers alike. Diners rave about the delightful Marsala paneer and cashew curry, which showcase the restaurant's commitment to quality ingredients and authentic flavors.
name: Ringo Starr Bundi Restaurant
address: CJWP+CP8, Unnamed Road, Balchand Para, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: Bundi, a charming town in Rajasthan, is easily accessible from Jaipur via direct bus or train, although the train service operates only on Fridays. This picturesque destination boasts an intriguing mix of history and nature, with its old military barracks now home to playful monkeys. Visitors should be cautious while exploring the steep trails that can be slippery at times but are manageable with care.
name: Bundi
address: Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: Nagar Sagar Kund is a bustling area just outside the old town, featuring lively bazaars offering a wide range of goods. It's a paradise for photographers with its vibrant atmosphere. The beautiful pond, known as Bawadi, adds to the charm of Bundi and serves as a major tourist attraction. However, it is noted that due to neglect and poor habits of the public, its beauty is diminishing over time.
name: Nagar Sagar Kund
address: Nagar Kund, Teerath, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: The Government Museum in Bundi, located within the Sukh Mahal complex, offers visitors a glimpse into the rich history and culture of the region. The museum is divided into three galleries showcasing sculptures, miniature paintings, and weaponry. It houses a collection of ancient statues unearthed through archaeological excavations, traditional Rajasthani paintings, and various weapons such as swords and arrows. Situated near the expansive Jait Sagar lake, the museum benefits from a pleasant location with refreshing breezes.
name: Government Museum
address: FJ3V+4GG, Jait Sagar Barrage, Teerath, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: Mangi Lal Samosa Center, one of the food courts in Bundi, is renowned for its delectable samosas. These fried delicacies have gained popularity and are considered some of the best in town. Visitors can expect long queues due to their high demand. To savor these tasty treats, customers need to pay a nominal fee of 10 rupees or $0.14 for a serving of two samosas and receive a green chip as proof of purchase.
name: Mangi Lal Samosa Center
address: CJRV+76Q, Hospital Area, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: Hanuman Temple, Madakhoh, is a serene and picturesque location nestled amidst lush green hills near Bundi. The Phool Sagar Lake, named after the grand Phool Mahal fortress built by Maharaja Bahadur Singh in 1945, adds to the charm of this place. It's a perfect spot for relaxation and offers a heavenly experience in the midst of nature.
name: Hanuman Temple, Madakhoh, Phool Sagar, Bundi
address: FJ47+887, Bundi- Rampuriya- Dalelpura- Borkhandi Rd, Rajasthan 323001, India

detail_description: Hathi Pol, which translates to Elephant Gate, is the grand entrance to Bundi Fort. This massive gateway features two trumpeting elephant statues forming an arc, creating a majestic and imposing entryway. Built by Rao Ratan Singh, this historical site offers a steep climb leading up to the palace and showcases impressive architecture that reflects the region's rich heritage.
name: Hathi Pol
address: FJ2P+8QW, Kala Mahalo Ki Gali, Teerath, Bundi, Rajasthan 323001, India

name: Indragarh Fort
address: Indergarh, Rajasthan 323613, India

name: Ramgarh Visdhari Tiger Reserve, RVTR Bundi
address: 172, Raghav Kripa,Gate no:5, Rajat Colony, Bherupura Antri, Rajasthan 323001, India
